newsitem.title: FRANCE: Crew of ill-fated balloon rescue by launch - official.
newsitem.headline: Crew of ill-fated balloon rescue by launch - official.

text.p: The two-man crew of a balloon was plucked from the Mediterranean by the French military on Sunday after aborting a round-the-world flight begun just hours before in Switzerland, officials said.
Neither man was hurt, a Defence Ministry spokesman told Reuters.
"The two men were picked up by a launch and are heading for La Grande Motte (a coastal resort east of Marseille)," the spokesman said.
Two helicopters, a patrol aircraft and at least two launches were involved in the rescue, the spokesman said.
The rescue took place shortly after 4 p.m. (1500 GMT).
